results.title: ‘War Pony’ Review: The Sad Absurdities of Reservation Life
results.abstract: Riley Keough and Gina Gammell’s stellar debut, starring many first-time actors, takes a deadpan look at a Lakota-Sioux reservation in South Dakota.

results.title: Despite Acquittal, Kevin Spacey Faces Uphill Battle for Hollywood Roles
results.abstract: The actor, who was cleared of sexual assault charges in Britain this week, has parts in two small upcoming films. Yet his tarnished public perception makes starry roles unlikely.
results.byline: By Alex Marshall and Maya Salam

multimedia.caption: “I imagine that many of you can understand that there’s a lot for me to process,” Kevin Spacey said from the courthouse steps in London after being acquitted of sexual assault charges.
“I imagine that many of you can understand that there’s a lot for me to process,” Kevin Spacey said from the courthouse steps in London after being acquitted of sexual assault charges.
“I imagine that many of you can understand that there’s a lot for me to process,” Kevin Spacey said from the courthouse steps in London after being acquitted of sexual assault charges.

results.title: ‘Oppenheimer’ Fans Are Rediscovering a 40-Year-Old Documentary
results.abstract: “The Day After Trinity,” made available without a subscription until August, shot to the top of the Criterion Channel’s most-watched films.

multimedia.caption: Decades before the movie “Oppenheimer,” J. Robert Oppenheimer and his work on the atomic bomb were the subject of the Academy Award-nominated documentary “The Day After Trinity.”
Decades before the movie “Oppenheimer,” J. Robert Oppenheimer and his work on the atomic bomb were the subject of the Academy Award-nominated documentary “The Day After Trinity.”

results.title: How Those ‘Barbie’ Dreamhouses Came to Life: ‘We All Had to Believe in It’
results.abstract: To make their Barbieland sets a reality, the movie’s production team embraced the surreal, going big on bright pinks and shrunken proportions.

multimedia.caption: Margot Robbie as Barbie in Greta Gerwig’s comedy hit. “It was one of the most difficult philosophical, intellectual, cerebral pieces of work we’ve ever done,” said Sarah Greenwood, who created the movie’s sets along with Katie Spencer.

results.title: Julian Barry, Who Made Lenny Bruce Into ‘Lenny,’ Dies at 92
results.abstract: Mr. Barry’s scripts for a hit Broadway play and later a Hollywood movie about that rule-breaking comic helped give Mr. Bruce a lasting place in pop culture lore.

multimedia.caption: Julian Barry backstage during rehearsals for a 1999 London production of “Lenny.” “In the play, I mythologized Lenny Bruce,” he said.
Julian Barry backstage during rehearsals for a 1999 London production of “Lenny.” “In the play, I mythologized Lenny Bruce,” he said.

results.title: ‘Bobi Wine: The People’s President’ Review: A Pop Star Turns Politician
results.abstract: Uganda has been under authoritarian rule for decades. Wine has doggedly challenged its leader, and this documentary shows the price he’s paid.

multimedia.caption: As a campaigner, Bobi Wine is cheerful and stylish, writes our critic. But the autocratic president’s attacks on him are relentless.

results.title: Bo Goldman, Oscar-Winning Screenwriter, Dies at 90
results.abstract: He was a struggling writer when he won an Academy Award for “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest.” He won another for “Melvin and Howard.”

results.title: Hollywood Strike Leaves Influencers Sidelined and Confused
results.abstract: Despite not being in the actors’ union, many content creators are passing up deals to promote films or TV shows because they don’t want to be barred from the guild or face online vitriol.

results.title: Greta Gerwig on the Blockbuster ‘Barbie’ Opening (and How She Got Away With It)
results.abstract: “I think it was a particular ripple in the universe that allowed it to happen,” the director said on Tuesday of her highly anticipated movie making a staggering $162 million in its first weekend.

multimedia.caption: Greta Gerwig, here in New York in 2022, spent Thursday and Friday spot-checking different theaters in the city. “It’s been amazing to walk around and see people in pink,” she said on Tuesday.
multimedia.copyright: Clement Pascal for The New York Times

results.title: Venice Film Festival Lineup Largely Unscathed by Hollywood Strikes
results.abstract: Movies from Bradley Cooper, Sofia Coppola and Ava DuVernay will debut at this year’s event, despite the industry shutdown.

multimedia.caption: Bradley Cooper as Leonard Bernstein in “Maestro,” which will premiere at this year’s Venice Film Festival. It is unclear if Hollywood stars like Cooper will walk the festival’s red carpet as usual.

results.title: Wrestling With His Past. And an Animatronic Shark.
results.abstract: Ian Shaw plays his father, Robert Shaw, in “The Shark Is Broken,” a comedy based on the troubled production of the 1975 film “Jaws.”

multimedia.caption: “You still have to have the conversation about your validity in comparison to your father,” Ian Shaw said. “The final piece of the puzzle to getting rid of the baggage has, peculiarly, been to walk in his shoes.”
multimedia.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.abstract: The former “Saturday Night Live” cast member faced a reckless driving charge in California. His father, a New York City firefighter, was killed responding to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

results.title: How the Indigo Girls Brought Barbie ‘Closer to Fine’
results.abstract: A 1989 song about soul searching has maintained cultural relevance for three decades, but the band has also long been the target of homophobic jokes. Fans are savoring a moment of vindication.

multimedia.caption: The Indigo Girls in 1989: Emily Saliers, left, and Amy Ray. Their song “Closer to Fine” is heard three times in the new “Barbie” movie.

results.title: ‘Barbie’ Box Office to the World: The Pandemic Is Officially Over
results.abstract: With the biggest revenues since 2019, “Barbenheimer” gives the usual franchises a run for their money, selling out even predawn screenings.

results.title: ‘Barbenheimer’ Is a Huge Hollywood Moment and Maybe the Last for a While
results.abstract: The big launch of “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” should have been a celebratory moment, but an industry on pause has darkened the mood.
